meanings.definition: to bring or take something from one place to another
meanings.sent1: I will carryout the groceries from the car to the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She always carries out her chores without being asked.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to carryout a picnic in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: His determination to carryout his plan was like a strong wind pushing him forward.
meanings.sent5: The students were asked to carryout the experiment to learn about science.

meanings.definition: the act of bringing or taking something from one place to another
meanings.sent1: The carryout of the boxes was done efficiently by the movers.
meanings.sent2: We ordered Chinese carryout for dinner last night.
meanings.sent3: The carryout of the treasure chest from the cave was a thrilling adventure.
meanings.sent4: The carryout of the mission's objectives was crucial for its success.
meanings.sent5: The carryout of the message to the king was entrusted to the royal messenger.
